channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Six Palestinian prisoners escape Israeli jail through tunnel
item.description: Israel launches a huge manhunt after six militants dig their way out of the high-security jail.

item.title: Twins conjoined at head separated after rare surgery in Israel
item.description: The one-year-old girls are said to be recovering well after the 12-hour operation in Israel.

item.title: French film great Jean-Paul Belmondo dies at 88
item.description: Star of Breathless, Jean-Paul Belmondo was one of France's most popular actors.

item.title: Guinea coup leader to form new government in weeks
item.description: Col Mamady Doumbouya says there will be no witch-hunt against former officials.

item.title: Facebook apology as AI labels black men 'primates'
item.description: The company says it was an "unacceptable error" and disabled the feature and launched an investigation.

item.title: Jean-Pierre Adams: Former France international dies after 39 years in coma
item.description: Former France footballer Jean-Pierre Adams, who had been in a coma for 39 years, has died at the age of 73.

item.title: Belarus jail terms for opposition figures Kolesnikova and Znak
item.description: Maria Kolesnikova receives 11 years in jail and Maxim Znak 10 on charges of trying to seize power.

item.title: Australian boy, 3, rescued after four days lost in bush
item.description: Anthony "AJ" Elfalak was spotted by a helicopter, drinking water from a creek near his home.

item.title: Nizar Banat: Palestinian officers charged over activist's death
item.description: Nizar Banat died shortly after being beaten in June, triggering an unprecedented wave of protests.

item.title: Taiwan says 19 Chinese warplanes entered air defence zone
item.description: Taiwan says nuclear-capable bombers were among the jets that flew into the air defence zone.

item.title: Mexico City to swap Columbus statue for one of indigenous woman
item.description: Mexico City's mayor said a statue of an Olmeca woman would replace that of the Italian explorer.

item.title: Saadi Gaddafi: Son of Libya's ex-leader freed from Tripoli jail
item.description: Saadi Gaddafi was cleared of killing the Libyan football coach, and targeting protesters.

item.title: Khalid Sheikh Mohammed: How '9/11 mastermind' slipped through FBI's fingers
item.description: Could the man accused of hatching the plot to fly planes into US landmarks 20 years ago have been stopped?

item.title: South Africa danger zone: Living in a 'hijacked' building
item.description: Pictures of squatters in a South African inner city with high levels of crime, drugs and prostitution.

item.title: Feria: Rural memoirs stir longing for Spain's past
item.description: Ana Iris Simón's autobiographical book triggers a frenzied debate about the loss of village life.

item.title: What election losers tell us about Indian democracy
item.description: Thousands of parties contest Indian polls but the rising participation masks a murky underbelly.

item.title: Climate change: Massive Attack gig data to cut live music impact
item.description: Artists should swap private jets for trains among recommendations from climate scientists.

item.title: Israeli conjoined twins see each other for first time after surgery
item.description: The Israeli twin girls were joined at the head but have been separated after a rare operation.

item.title: Afghanistan: Rural areas welcome peace and end of war
item.description: In more rural areas of Afghanistan, people welcome the end of a war that has killed tens of thousands.

item.title: Saving Australian frog species on the brink of extinction
item.description: Scientists fear four species are already extinct but say urgent action can save others.

item.title: US Senator Lindsey Graham: 'We will be going back into Afghanistan'
item.description: Republican Senator Lindsey Graham believes there will be no choice as "the threat will be so large".

item.title: Paralympics: ‘We the disabled community are here to stay’
item.description: Four champions share their glory and their pain from the 16th Paralympic Games in Tokyo.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban accused of killing pregnant police officer
item.description: The killing comes amid increasing reports of escalating repression of women in Afghanistan.

item.title: The Taliban embrace social media: 'We too want to change perceptions'
item.description: Famed for their shunning of technology, the Taliban are realising they need to be on social media too.

item.title: Afghanistan: What's life like since the Taliban took over?
item.description: People around the country tell the BBC they have lost basic freedoms and are struggling to survive.

item.title: Afghanistan women's cricket team: Players hiding in Kabul fear Taliban rule
item.description: Members of Afghanistan's women's cricket team are hiding in Kabul, fearing for their safety following the Taliban's return to power.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'Everyone got it wrong' on Taliban takeover - armed forces chief
item.description: Gen Sir Nick Carter says the speed of the Taliban's takeover of Afghanistan surprised the UK.
